items.sentence: I hope we can get together again. Yes, I'll be looking forward to it.
They had been dancing for an hour when there was a knock on the door.
I don't know how this game is played, but it's entertaining to watch.
My family moved from Boston to Chicago when I was thirteen years old.
I wish that I could've spent more time with my father before he died.
I can't support a family on the amount of money I make from that job.
You're the last person who should preach about political correctness.
In the attic is my grandfather's old first-aid kit from World War II.
When Tom got married, his father gave him a car as a wedding present.
Tom can sleep in my room. I'll sleep on the couch in the living room.
